title: The five stages of Loss and Grief
body:
1. Denial and Isolation=  Check!
2. Anger= Check!
3. Bargaining.... Lemme fix that...    Hey there, hope this helps you reconsider some of the Mordekaiser changes....

4. Depression= Watching Metalocalypse, drinking some Vodka and listening to Dio while saying my last farewells to Morde....
5. Acceptance= Never!

Just curious: have any of you actually used the kit on the pbe?

Yep. It's early sucks dick, going the build CertainlyT and the rest of Riot wants you to build makes it to where you're useless late game due to Hybrid damage (Literally, they made him magic damage and want him to build AD/Tank, so he can't even put to use a damn Cleaver like a normal AD Fighter), and his mid game is easily shut down before he even gets there by simply having a knock back. Morde needs to WALK to his target. Walk to them. No gap closer or CC, so he has to chase them. If the enemies get an Alistar, Syndra, Xin, or an Anivia (Wall of super denial), the Morde is completely screwed. You can still screw him with normal stuff like slows since he's stupid easy to kite, thus needing his team to do ANYTHING and your only damaging ability is your Q since the E's scaling is iffy at best as the build they want you to go unless you get plenty of AD, but their build says tanky AD. They want a TANK. Like, their recommended items that they're balancing around is Ninja Tabi, Trinity Force, Rylai's, Gunblade, Spirit Visage, and another tanky item. It's... It does a lot of damage, but at the same time, it... it just doesn't scale to late due to being hybrid/tanky. The Q will do around 1kish in total, but you only attack at about 1 per sec, so it takes 3s to do 1k damage and your opponent has to stand still for that ENTIRE time, so it could take upwards of 4-5s to get it off on a moving target. 

His kit is scaled so nearly all of his power in his Q. His E is just for shields and the slow with Rylai's, possible for use in farming early on if you're being zoned (Which is common since he's melee with 325 movement speed) and his bases are HORRIBLE, so he doesn't do anything early on.

I would go for alacrity instead of furor, since phage helps you stick after you get to the target. Phage into Rylai's might actually be a very good idea. But it seems we had different experiences. I really enjoyed the Bot Lane Morde. Its novel, he has all the tools to deal with harass, and has some pretty easy last hitting from what I played.

I figure my experience shouldn't encompass all, but that IS the experience I had. I never had problems with last hitting, just every adc I played against was able to out-harass me by a lot(vayne, cait, varus, draven)

Honestly my big problem with the rework is that it FORCED morde into a duo lane. It didn't really solve the problems that he had before(super oppressive to melee, can barely do anything to ranged), and it goes against him thematically as well. As others have said, why does the Murder emperor need to rely on anyone else to be completely useful? He is the master of metal, THE MURDER EMPEROR. he shouldn't *need* to rely on anyone else. I think if he was able to work with someone else but not be totally reliant on them(aka work in duo but still be fully useful solo) that would be great. In fact I am posting my idea of a rework that solves those problems(I hope) and still conserves his strengths/weaknesses. I would have posted it yesterday, but I hit a button when I was almost done and erased it all >.<

Hmm. The way the lore presents him nowadays is more of a general of the undead army, alongside hecarim and friends, instead of a lone force of destruction. Makes bot lane looks more sensible. 

But yeah, as much as I like new morde, its still dumb that they removed his solo lane ability. I really think they should let morde self-cast W for a lesser effect.

I'm sorry but I can't accept CertainlyT doing this.

Riot said the entire reason they reworked Skarner was because "feast or famine" designs [where a champion destroys anything that gets close, but is useless if they can't catch up] were bad. BUT THAT IS WHAT THIS WILL MAKE MORDEKAISER.

And how does he catch up to enemies now? By relying on a good support to position him with correct use of W, and stun enemies so he can delete them. If he doesn't have a good support [and we know they can be rare in solo queue], he's a slow, kiteable tank with no CC and three abilties, who gets to have a Dragon *if his team shows up to contest it.*

So 5.16 Mordekaiser will either be permabanned after release for his potential power with a good team [like every other CertainlyT design which has been pick/ban tier at least once], or if he isn't banned but has a bad team, he'll be worthless.

That's a "binary" and un-fun design right there. Relying on allies for yourself to be useful, and new Morde being banned because he's OP when you have good allies, is the opposite of fun. For Morde mains, as well as for his enemies.

That's me on Fi right now.
